thread.title: Ross Kemp admits being "quite vain" and "lulled into a sense of self-importance" while at EastEnders
thread.title_full: Ross Kemp admits being "quite vain" and "lulled into a sense of self-importance" while at EastEnders

author: Lara Martin
title: Ross Kemp admits being "quite vain" and "lulled into a sense of self-importance" while at EastEnders
text:
Share this video Watch Next 
But although many people still associate him with his Grant character, he insists he’s a very different person to both Grant and how he himself was during that era. 
“I’m a very different person to when I was in EastEnders. I did it aged 25 to 35. I was young and naive and even though I was follicle challenged, I was quite vain,” he told The Guardian . 
“I got lulled into a sense of my own self-importance,” he added. 
“I don’t take myself that seriously any more.” Ross says he's a very different person to Grant (Photo: Getty) Ross is best known for his documentaries these day. Pictured in Sky 1's Ross Kemp: Libyan Migrant Hell (Photo: Â©Sky UK Limited) 
“Some people still think I’m Grant Mitchell,” he added. “He had a Neanderthal-type thuggery about him. I’m not necessarily professing to be the brightest person on the planet, but I think once people have a conversation with me, they work out he was just a character I played.” 
Ross’ most recent return to Albert Square was for Lady Barbara Windsor’s exit storyline as Peggy. 
He said last year he wouldn’t rule out another return. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
